Package data

Class SavableFileIO<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • data.SavableFileIO<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - Type of object manipulated.
    public class SavableFileIO<T>
extends java.lang.Object
    Store and load serialized objects. Each of these savers can only handle saving and loading objects of one type.
    Author:
    matt

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      class  SavableFileIO.AppendingObjectOutputStream
      Hack for appending to files rather than starting from scratch.

      Whether to display debugging/progress messages.

      • SavableFileIO

        public SavableFileIO()

    • Method Detail

      • storeObjects

        public void storeObjects​(java.util.Collection<T> data,
                         java.io.File saveFile,
                         boolean append)
        Store objects to file.
        Parameters:
        data - Objects matching the generic of this saver that will be sent to file.
        saveFile - File to save data to. If the file does not exist, it will be created as will any folders needed to get to this new file.
        append - Append data to an existing file (true), or make a new file (false). Will tolerate append being true even if the file does not exist, and will create the file anyway.

      • loadObjectsToCollection

        public void loadObjectsToCollection​(java.io.File file,
                                    java.util.Collection<T> collection)
        Load objects from a save file. They will be put in the provided collection. The provided collection will not be cleared before adding objects.
        Parameters:
        file - Saved file to load from.
        collection - Collection (e.g. List, Set) to put the loaded objects in.

      • combineFiles

        public void combineFiles​(java.io.File[] inputFiles,
                         java.io.File destination)
        Combine multiple files into one output file, eliminating any duplicates. Does not delete the original files.
        Parameters:
        inputFiles - Multiple files with saved objects that we wish to combine into a single file. All these files must contain the same object type.
        destination - Output file for the combined objects found in inputFiles.

      • getFilesByExtension

        public static java.util.Set<java.io.File> getFilesByExtension​(java.io.File directory,
                                                              java.lang.String extension)
        Get all files in the working directory with a specified file extension. Case insensitive.
        Parameters:
        directory - File directory to look in.
        extension - File extension. Tolerates ".foo" or "foo".
        Returns:
        List of files with the specified file extension.

      • printFileSize

        public static void printFileSize​(java.io.File file)
        Print the size of a file in megabytes. For debugging stuff.
        Parameters:
        file - File to check the size of.
